Data / Residual / Signal ContainerÔÉÅ

class lisatools.datacontainer.DataResidualArray(data_res_in, dt=None, f_arr=None, df=None, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Container to hold sensitivity information.

Parameters:

  • f ‚Äì Frequency array.

  • sens_mat ‚Äì Input sensitivity list. The shape of the nested lists should represent the shape of the desired matrix. Each entry in the list must be an array, Sensitivity-derived object, or a string corresponding to the Sensitivity object.

  • **sens_kwargs ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to :method:`Sensitivity.get_Sn`.

property char_strain: ndarrayÔÉÅ

Characteristic strain representation of the data.

property init_kwargs: dictÔÉÅ

Initial dt, df, f_arr

loglog(ax=None, fig=None, inds=None, char_strain=False, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Produce a log-log plot of the data.

Parameters:

  • ax (Union[List[Axes], Axes, None], default: None) ‚Äì Matplotlib Axes objects to add plots. Either a list of Axes objects or a single Axes object.

  • fig (Optional[Figure], default: None) ‚Äì Matplotlib figure object.

  • inds (Union[List[int], int, None], default: None) ‚Äì Integer index to select out which data to add to a single access. A list can be provided if ax is a list. They must be the same length.

  • char_strain (Optional[bool], default: False) ‚Äì If True return plot in characteristic strain representation.

  • **kwargs (dict) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to be passed to loglog function in matplotlib.

Return type:

Tuple[Figure, Axes]

Returns:

Matplotlib figure and axes objects in a 2-tuple.

Analysis ContainerÔÉÅ

class lisatools.analysiscontainer.AnalysisContainer(data_res_arr, sens_mat, signal_gen=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Combinatorial container that combines sensitivity and data information.

Parameters:

  • data_res_arr (DataResidualArray) ‚Äì Data / Residual / Signal array.

  • sens_mat (SensitivityMatrix) ‚Äì Sensitivity information.

  • signal_gen (Optional[callable], default: None) ‚Äì Callable object that takes information through *args and **kwargs and generates a signal in the proper channel setup employed in data_res_arr and sens_mat.

calculate_signal_inner_product(*args, source_only=False, waveform_kwargs={}, data_res_arr_kwargs={}, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Return the inner product of a generated signal with the data.

Parameters:

  • *args (Union[Buffer, _SupportsArray[dtype[Any]], _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]]], bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes, _NestedSequence[Union[bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes]]]) ‚Äì Arguments to waveform generating function. Must include parameters.

  • source_only (bool, default: False) ‚Äì If True return the source-only Likelihood (leave out noise part).

  • waveform_kwargs (Optional[dict], default: {}) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to waveform generator.

  • data_res_arr_kwargs (Optional[dict], default: {}) ‚Äì Keyword arguments for instantiation of DataResidualArray. This can be used if any transforms are desired prior to the Likelihood computation.

  • **kwargs (dict) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to lisatools.diagnostic.inner_product()

Return type:

float | complex

Returns:

Inner product value.

calculate_signal_likelihood(*args, source_only=False, waveform_kwargs={}, data_res_arr_kwargs={}, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Return the likelihood of a generated signal with the data.

Parameters:

  • params ‚Äì Arguments to waveform generating function. Must include parameters.

  • source_only (bool, default: False) ‚Äì If True return the source-only Likelihood (leave out noise part).

  • waveform_kwargs (Optional[dict], default: {}) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to waveform generator.

  • data_res_arr_kwargs (Optional[dict], default: {}) ‚Äì Keyword arguments for instantiation of DataResidualArray. This can be used if any transforms are desired prior to the Likelihood computation.

  • **kwargs (dict) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to lisatools.diagnostic.inner_product()

Return type:

float | complex

Returns:

Likelihood value.

calculate_signal_snr(*args, source_only=False, waveform_kwargs={}, data_res_arr_kwargs={}, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Return the SNR of a generated signal with the data.

Parameters:

  • *args (Union[Buffer, _SupportsArray[dtype[Any]], _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]]], bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes, _NestedSequence[Union[bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes]]]) ‚Äì Arguments to waveform generating function. Must include parameters.

  • source_only (bool, default: False) ‚Äì If True return the source-only Likelihood (leave out noise part).

  • waveform_kwargs (Optional[dict], default: {}) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to waveform generator.

  • data_res_arr_kwargs (Optional[dict], default: {}) ‚Äì Keyword arguments for instantiation of DataResidualArray. This can be used if any transforms are desired prior to the Likelihood computation.

  • **kwargs (dict) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to lisatools.diagnostic.inner_product()

Return type:

Tuple[float, float]

Returns:

Snr values (optimal, detected).

likelihood(source_only=False, noise_only=False, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Return the likelihood of the current arangement.

Parameters:

  • source_only (bool, default: False) ‚Äì If True return the source-only Likelihood.

  • noise_only (bool, default: False) ‚Äì If True, return the noise part of the Likelihood alone.

  • **kwargs (dict) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to lisatools.diagnostic.inner_product().

Return type:

float | complex

Returns:

Likelihood value.

  • **kwargs (dict) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to lisatools.diagnostic.inner_product().

template_likelihood(template, include_psd_info=False, phase_maximize=False, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Calculate the Likelihood of a template against the data.

Parameters:

  • template (DataResidualArray) ‚Äì Template signal.

  • include_psd_info (bool, default: False) ‚Äì If True, add the PSD term to the Likelihood value.

  • phase_maximize (bool, default: False) ‚Äì If True, maximize over an overall phase.

  • **kwargs (dict) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to lisatools.diagnostic.inner_product().

Return type:

float

Returns:

Likelihood value.

template_snr(template, phase_maximize=False, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Calculate the SNR of a template, both optimal and detected.

Parameters:

  • template (DataResidualArray) ‚Äì Template signal.

  • phase_maximize (bool, default: False) ‚Äì If True, maximize over an overall phase.

  • **kwargs (dict) ‚Äì Keyword arguments to pass to lisatools.diagnostic.inner_product().

Return type:

Tuple[float, float]

Returns:

(optimal snr, detected snr).
